qas.question: How long might a feud last?

answers.text: a few days up to multiple decades

qas.question: How long did the feud between Ric Flair and Ricky Steamboat last?
What is an example of a popular feud?

answers.text: Stone Cold Steve Austin vs. Mr. McMahon

context: Other stories result from a natural rivalry between two or more characters. Outside of performance, these are referred to as <a0_0>feuds<a0_0/>. A feud can exist between any number of participants and can last for <a1_0>a few days up to multiple decades<a1_0/>. The feud between Ric Flair and Ricky Steamboat lasted from the <a2_0>late 1970s into the early 1990s<a2_0/> and allegedly spanned over two thousand matches (although most of those matches were mere dark matches). The career-spanning history between characters Mike Awesome and Masato Tanaka is another example of a long-running feud, as is the case of <a3_0>Stone Cold Steve Austin vs. Mr. McMahon<a3_0/>, one of the most lucrative feuds in the World Wrestling Federation (WWF) during 1998 and 1999.
